newsitem.title: USA: Activision names Kelly president,Plaga CFO.
newsitem.headline: Activision names Kelly president,Plaga CFO.

text.p: Activision Inc said Friday that Brian Kelly had been named president and would be succeeded as chief financial officer by Barry Plaga.
As president, Kelly succeeds Bobby Kotick, who continues as chairman and chief executive officer.
Activision said a corporate realignment involves the promotion of several key executives and the implementation of a corporate team reorganization.
Kelly continues as chief operating officer and secretary and will continue to oversee the day-to-day operations of the company.
Plaga had been senior vice president-finance and chief accounting officer. The company said he will oversee all of its corporate finances.

Several other executives were named senior vice presidents, including John Baker, who had been vice president-operations, administration and planning. He becomes senior vice president-corporate development, responsible for strategic and financial planning, investor relations and corporate merger and acquisition efforts.
